Type.Name: EntryPointNotFoundException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit EntryPointNotFoundException extends System.TypeLoadException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when an attempt to load a fails due to the absence of an entry point.

para.block: In C#, an entry point is defined through the Main() method. For additional information about entry points, see Partition II of the CLI Specification.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Entry point was not found." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The property of the new instance is initialized to .

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
